item.title: Dumped brown bin, 14th December
item.description:
A brown bin has appeared over the last 2 weeks and belongs to no one. Residents keep moving it down the road as they done want it outside their house and it has now been dumped outside Wellspring Church

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The tree outside 24 Blenheim Road., 14th December
item.description:
The tree outside our property is far too big and towers over us. It blocks the light, sheds numerous leaves causing the pavement and driveway to be very dangerous. We are very concerned about the roots encroaching on our property and damaging our new driveway. We have lived here for three and a half years and the tree has never been pruned in that time. We reported this issue in the spring time and was told that the tree would be pruned at the end of the year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: GQMW+9C3 London, 14th December
item.description:
I write with regard to the large pothole I just drove into on the roundabout. The pothole cannot be seen until you hit it. itâ€™s at a busy junction and it caught me off-guard. It needs to be fixed immediately. It is large and deep and may have cause significant damage to vehicle.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salusbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter by benches, 14th December
item.description:
There are 2 benches along this path which runs across Martin's Hill parallel to the Ravensbourne but higher up . One bench is below the path and the other is on the path. Today there was litter by both benches. There often is. It would be very helpful and sensible to have a bin by the bench that is on the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glassmill Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe cycling surface, 14th December
item.description:
As others have reported the new surface that has been laid from the road into the newly pedestrianised square and cycle lane is highly dangerous. I am one of the many reports you have on here, and to the council directly that came off my bike on the morning of the 5th December (I cycle that junction every day so know it well). There is zero traction where the surfaces change and when it is even slightly icy and no grit. I have broken my elbow and require surgery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Absndoned car on flat bed truck on Lytchet Road BR1, 14th December
item.description:
Thus car, with registration plates removed, and on a flat bed truck has been in this Controlled parking zone for some time. The truck is attached to a Council lampost with a metal chain - see my photo. Could this please be removed. Thank you. Cllr Alisa Igoe

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
